$interpreted: Middle-aged Noble: Congratulations King Theodore. That was an astounding victory over those treacherous traitors!
Theodore: This is all due to the support and effort from you fellow nobles.
Middle-aged Noble: On top of it all, we've taken two important prisoners of war. The princess' forces just lost an arm and a leg!
Theodore: ...Princess? Do you still consider her a rightful member of the royal family?
Middle-aged Noble: A simple slip of the tongue! I meant the traitor Angelia!
Female Noble: Y-Yeah! Pity we were unable to capture Angelia in battle. We should gather our forces to wipe the traitors out once and for all!
Theodore: ...It's not the best time for such action. According to our military intelligence,
Theodore: those lizards in the desert are becoming restless. The Sunshine Infantry has been crippled; they don't pose a threat now.
Theodore: We will figure out what the lizards are up to, then we can finish off the rebels with ease.
Middle-aged Noble: A wise decision. No matter what kind of threat the kingdom faces, we will follow royal orders and lend our troops to the kingdom.
Female Noble: However, since the soldiers are from our domain, it's still a burden to us.  If possible, we would like...
Theodore: Although the kingdom is still recovering both politically and financially from the collapse of the castle in Atlas,
Theodore: I will certainly not overlook your contributions...
Theodore: Fredrica!
Theodore: Organize a team and order them to explore every inch of Maple Lake. After the civil war is over, I will claim that land as a territory of the kingdom.

Theodore: I will then distribute the lands to fellow nobles as a reward, based on your accolades during the war. 
Is this...enough to satisfy everyone?
Middle-aged Noble: Quite encouraging news, Your Majesty!
Female Noble: Keep the party going. A toast to King Theodore!
Fredrica: Your Majesty, I know you've been exhausted of late trying to satisfy those weasels, but it would be such a kindness if you could stop giving me more work...
Theodore: Enough with your whining. Has our special little someone reported anything yet?
Fredrica: Oh, about Angelia's whereabouts~ They said...
Leah: ...Panther territory is right around here. Before I enrolled, I visited here with Tica.
Leah: We had an exciting adventure. You wanna hear about it?
Leah: Hello~ Seriously! Are you even listening to me?
Elio: Oh, apologies. I was thinking about something...
Elio: It's getting late. It's best we return to the Academy as soon as possible.
Leah: (Elio Ceres...thought he was the sociable type. Didn't expect him to be such a cold, distant person.)
Leah: (And here I thought I could get some favorable grades by being on good terms with him. Guess thsi ain't working...)
Elio: Isn't that Miss Fatima!?
Leah: How dare they attack our friend. We've gotta help her!
Hyde: Wait, wait! We have no malicious intentions, please stop!
Fatima: You two set foot onto prohibited Panther territory. That's plenty malicious!
Angelia: It's true. We scheduled a meeting with Headmaster Ceres at Whistlewood Valley, but we got lost. That's why we ended up here by accident...
Elio: Father's visitors!?
Elio: This is probably a misunderstanding. Both sides, please stop!
Hyde: Looks like we have a reasonable person here. How should I address you two?
Leah: He is Elio Ceres, son of Headmaster Ceres.
Hyde: So Headmaster Charle is married? My, my, now that's something I hadn't heard.
Elio: Umm... I...
Leah: And I am Leah, superstar freshman of the academy. Nice to meet you.
Angelia: Student of Rune Academy...Leah...?
Angelia: Could it be that you're Lio's older sister!?
Leah: You knew Lio!? What happened to him? I wrote several letters back to the Slums, yet have received no reply at all...
Leah: Nigel and Cin also didn't reply to my letters. Stamps are expensive, you know.
Angelia: ...Umm, there may be a small misunderstanding...
Leah: Or is it because I was too busy studying and took a while to contact them? They got mad and decided to give me a taste of my own medicine...
Angelia: ...It's probably because they couldn't send you anything, not because they didn't want to...
Leah: What do you mean?
Angelia: ...To be honest with you, due to the civil war, the mailing network between different regions have been placed under strict regulations.
Leah: Is it really that bad!? Then is Lio doing okay!?
Angelia: Calm down, he's doing just fine. I'll tell you the details later...
Hyde: Looks like we cleared up the misunderstanding. Can you put down your weapon now?
Fatima: For the sake of Charle and Elio, I'll let you two off the hook this time.
Fatima: Next time you bother us, you will be punished; no exceptions!
Elio: Now, shall I escort you two to Rune Academy?
Hyde: No, us visiting the Academy will only bring trouble to the headmaster. Young fella, please bring the message to him and ask him to come see us.
Elio: ...Just who are you guys exactly?

Model.Text: Congratulations King Theodore. That was an astounding victory over those treacherous traitors!
This is all due to the support and effort from you fellow nobles.
On top of it all, we've taken two important prisoners of war. The princess' forces just lost an arm and a leg!
...Princess? Do you still consider her a rightful member of the royal family?
A simple slip of the tongue! I meant the traitor Angelia!
Y-Yeah! Pity we were unable to capture Angelia in battle. We should gather our forces to wipe the traitors out once and for all!
...It's not the best time for such action. According to our military intelligence,
those lizards in the desert are becoming restless. The Sunshine Infantry has been crippled; they don't pose a threat now.
We will figure out what the lizards are up to, then we can finish off the rebels with ease.
A wise decision. No matter what kind of threat the kingdom faces, we will follow royal orders and lend our troops to the kingdom.
However, since the soldiers are from our domain, it's still a burden to us.  If possible, we would like...
Although the kingdom is still recovering both politically and financially from the collapse of the castle in Atlas,
I will certainly not overlook your contributions...
Fredrica!
Organize a team and order them to explore every inch of Maple Lake. After the civil war is over, I will claim that land as a territory of the kingdom.

I will then distribute the lands to fellow nobles as a reward, based on your accolades during the war. 
Is this...enough to satisfy everyone?
Quite encouraging news, Your Majesty!
Keep the party going. A toast to King Theodore!
Your Majesty, I know you've been exhausted of late trying to satisfy those weasels, but it would be such a kindness if you could stop giving me more work...
Enough with your whining. Has our special little someone reported anything yet?
Oh, about Angelia's whereabouts~ They said...
...Panther territory is right around here. Before I enrolled, I visited here with Tica.
We had an exciting adventure. You wanna hear about it?
Hello~ Seriously! Are you even listening to me?
Oh, apologies. I was thinking about something...
It's getting late. It's best we return to the Academy as soon as possible.
(Elio Ceres...thought he was the sociable type. Didn't expect him to be such a cold, distant person.)
(And here I thought I could get some favorable grades by being on good terms with him. Guess thsi ain't working...)
Isn't that Miss Fatima!?
How dare they attack our friend. We've gotta help her!
Wait, wait! We have no malicious intentions, please stop!
You two set foot onto prohibited Panther territory. That's plenty malicious!
It's true. We scheduled a meeting with Headmaster Ceres at Whistlewood Valley, but we got lost. That's why we ended up here by accident...
Father's visitors!?
This is probably a misunderstanding. Both sides, please stop!
Looks like we have a reasonable person here. How should I address you two?
He is Elio Ceres, son of Headmaster Ceres.
So Headmaster Charle is married? My, my, now that's something I hadn't heard.
Umm... I...
And I am Leah, superstar freshman of the academy. Nice to meet you.
Student of Rune Academy...Leah...?
Could it be that you're Lio's older sister!?
You knew Lio!? What happened to him? I wrote several letters back to the Slums, yet have received no reply at all...
Nigel and Cin also didn't reply to my letters. Stamps are expensive, you know.
...Umm, there may be a small misunderstanding...
Or is it because I was too busy studying and took a while to contact them? They got mad and decided to give me a taste of my own medicine...
...It's probably because they couldn't send you anything, not because they didn't want to...
What do you mean?
...To be honest with you, due to the civil war, the mailing network between different regions have been placed under strict regulations.
Is it really that bad!? Then is Lio doing okay!?
Calm down, he's doing just fine. I'll tell you the details later...
Looks like we cleared up the misunderstanding. Can you put down your weapon now?
For the sake of Charle and Elio, I'll let you two off the hook this time.
Next time you bother us, you will be punished; no exceptions!
Now, shall I escort you two to Rune Academy?
No, us visiting the Academy will only bring trouble to the headmaster. Young fella, please bring the message to him and ask him to come see us.
...Just who are you guys exactly?
